alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing only metal atoms of at least two different types, where the heaviest atom is a metalloid.
alternative_parents.name: Intermetallic metalloid compounds

alternative_parents.description: Heterocyclic compounds contain one metal ring atom.
alternative_parents.name: Metalloheterocyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds containing arsenic with one or more less electronegative elements.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic arsenides

class.description: Inorganic halogenic compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a metalloid.
class.name: Metalloid salts

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as metalloid salts. These are inorganic halogenic compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a metalloid.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic halogenic compounds in which the heaviest metal atom is a metalloid.
direct_parent.name: Metalloid salts

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
